data.title: Delicious meal to end the day
data.text: Good choice while in Utah and take a time when it is light and you can enjoy the view. Food and service are great.

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: Came to dinner here with a business conference and couldn't have been more pleased. Our servers were excellent and the food was delicious. Had the bacon-wrapped scallops and the cheese and jalapeño stuffed potato skins for appetizers. Both were delicious. The salad comes family-style in a large bowl with homemade dressings and croutons. I enjoyed the ribeye with asparagus as my entree and was too full to even think about the delicious desserts. The wine list, both by the glass and by the bottle, was quite nice and filled my needs nicely. I likely will return.

data.title: An Old Favorite
data.text: Have been to The Steak Pit whenever we vacation at Snowbird. Always love the food and ambience even if a bit pricey. You don't have to buy the most expensive things on the menu, the chicken or kabobs are great. Save room for hula pie ( can't remember if that is their name for it but that is what it is ) and share it as it's quite large.

data.title: Ambiance doesn't make up for really bad food - stay away!!
data.text:
The service was good, although they were out of the special right after opening!? the salad fine, nothing special (basically bagged salad like some reviews say with small tomatoes and thickly sliced cucumber added). However the very expensive  meals were all bland, cool, and small. First the salmon was bland, undercooked, and the sauce tasteless. The potato side with cheese was also bland and tasteless. We didn't even finish any of that with three people. 
The steaks? two cuts ordered, both overcooked beyond medium rare, both very bland. It was sad that even the peppercorn New York strip with sherry and wild mushroom sauce was almost tasteless!! how is that possible? and the Rib Eye with sea salt....what do I say? also tasteless and overcooked. Just terrible. And the side, steamed asparagus - what an inedible tasteless affair!! Just garbage.
We tried to rescue the evening with a slice of cake - straight out of some box! and bland, of course. Didn't finish that either.
We sat outside which was fine, but I recommend staying at the Lift House where at least the drinks we reasonably priced and the appetizers (wings) were edible.
Maybe we had the really bad shift on a Wednesday evening, but for the prices even the really crappy crew needs to be WAY better than this. Go somewhere else or you'll be disappointed.

data.title: Cool evening
data.text: We ordered three different types of meals and we dined outdoors with two fellow potguts (like a chipmunk) running around hoping to eat our fallen tidbits. The view was spectacular and the weather was just right, with a sweater.  The service was marvellous.

data.title: Best steak house in Utah
data.text: We just celebrated our 47th wedding anniversary with a delicious steak Oscar at the Steak Pit. We celebrated our first anniversary also.... 46 years ago. Delicious warm bread, artichoke with citrus aoli, unlimited salad bowl with exceptional home made Caesar, blue cheese and thousand island dressing all preceded the best filet mignon with generous real crab topped with Bernadine sauce. Home made blue berry amarreto cake to finish. We sat on the patio listening to the river and watching the deer. Can't wait until next year.

data.title: Great food in a very nice setup
data.text: This place is both very pleasant in terms of ambiance (maybe a bit dark, but it's makes it very intimate) and people. The service is friendly and very efficient and the food excellent. Even if the house special is meat I had here crab and I have to say that it's been a great meal. Portions are large and you won't leave the place hungry. Having a look at the other tables the meat meals look abundant and good. I'll have to try next time. Definitely recommended if your budget allows it.

data.title: Fairly good .... And pricey!
data.text: Our family of four went here for dinner after skiing. My eight year old son had tough time with menu. Nothing for him on kids menu to his liking. The waitress gave us a side of potato chips for him ( little did we know she charged us for them until we got bill; he didnt even eat them). Food was pricey but decent. My husband had fish dish and it was rather small portion for price. I had a steak that was fairly good, but didn't think it was worth the price tag of $44.  The salad was very good with choice of three dressings on side. Overall, it was not worth a second trip back. We went elsewhere remainder of trip. Advise you to check menu and pricing before going with family, especially if you have small kids.

data.title: Amazing food
data.text:
I haven’t been to the Steak Pit in over 20 years.  This place is amazing.. My husband and I will be going back very soon.  We were told that their prices were out of this world.  BUT what is out of this world is the incredible food.  The steaks were cooked to perfection and the dinner came with a salad served family style and one other side.  This place was expensive but NOT over the top.

When we finished eating our waiter told us that if we would like to stay a little longer that they would be feeding Larry the porcupine his bread for the night.  I have never been told by a waiter that we could stay longer.  Usually they want you to leave so they can clean up. Unfortunately we did not stay to see Larry.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: I could have had just the salad for dinner it was excellent and tons of it. The steak was very good.

data.title: Very good but pricey
data.text: Located in the Snowbird Center, The Steak Pit has survived for a good thirty years, so they must be doing something right.  Service and food were very good, I had the trout.  We were seated at a window table where you can watch for their "pet" porcupine; however he didn't visit while we were there.  Entrees include a very good salad, with three different dressings to choose from. I would go back...

data.title: Dine in Relaxed Comfort After Pounding the Mountain at Snowbird!
data.text: It's been a long day at Snowbird, or Alta.  You're exhausted but feeling fantastic after flying down 3,000 vertical feet over and over, all day long.  Now I'm hungry!  And I feel like treating myself to a special meal...PLEASE head directly to The Steak Pit, located in the Tram Center at Snowbird.  Here you'll be treated to great service, outstanding quality steaks and other entrees, with extras thrown in you'd normally pay for at other restaurants.  We enjoyed NY strip steaks, and ended up taking half of one home to our lodge, and having it the next night for dinner!  It was delicious.  Freshly baked breads are great, and lots of fresh salad with secret dressings (we got the recipe!) from our fantastic server Crystal.  This was an excellent meal all around, and we're going back.

data.title: Great group meal!
data.text: We were there with a group of 15 on a Friday night. The restaurant staff were pleasant and efficient in  accommodating our group.  The food and service were great!  The waitresses, Crystal and Heather were wonderful. They were pleasant, competent and attentive to us.  Yes, it is expensive but we were pleased with the value of our experience.  We will be back!!

data.title: Overpriced and mediocre
data.text: Don't waste your time or money on this typical resort type of eatery. Let's start with the salad which originated from a bag of field greens, add cucumber and cherry tomatoes. Adorn it with sides of (excellent) dressings, far too much to use.  Eat what you can and the waste gets thrown out.  My husband had the tasteless salmon and I had the not to bad trout. The bread was delicious but the double baked potato bland. A definite lack of creativity.  Not much chance of repeat customers in this tourism environment.

data.title: very ordinary and high prices decor hasn t changed in 30 years
data.text: This standby has been in service for over 39 years- as Jerry the waiter told me he has been there almost 40 years. You get okay steaks in the 45 dollar range with unlimited salad and no charge for a potato. Wine prices are wildly high as in the Aerie. The highlight is when Larry the porcupine comes to visit. The staff gives Larry bread so he won t eat the bark off trees. All porcupines there are named Larry so I m not sure which Larry iteration I saw. The kids will be thrilled. In the old days Steak Pit was only walk in--they now honor and encourage reservations. Decor is very dated..Given the limited dining options at Snowbird if one stays there over 4 days then one will probably make it down to the Steak Pit. There is fish available for the non steak eater..

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: Steaks done perfectly, and our server, Beth, was great. When there a slight mistake with the final check, they pointed it out to us, apologized and made it good. Loved the endless bowl of salad on the table with the homemade dressings. Could make a meal of just that (but don't!).

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text:
Steak Pit at Snowbird is a hidden gem.  Steak was done just right, and with a Caymus Cabernet Sauvignon, dinner was perfect for our last night at Snowbird.

An added attraction was Larry the Porcupine's appearance to get his nightly bread.

data.title: Steak, no fish.
data.text: There are not too many choices when it comes to restaurants in Snowbird. The Steak Pit seemed to be a good choice. It was good for the steak, but unfortunately not so for the fish. I ordered a salmon, which was dry, obviously indicating it had been frozen before and did not taste very good.  The rest of our experience was good. However,  living in mid-America I am used to much better pricing when it comes to steak houses like this. Of course,  we understand that when you stay at a resort you have to pay the price.

data.title: Fabulous meal!
data.text: This place is a goldmine! The food was amazing and there was a lot of it! All the meals come with a side and a salad. I had the filet (medium rare) with a cheese potato. Amazing. The filet was cooked to perfection. Service was excellent. Couldn't have asked for a better experience. Will definitely be back.

data.title: Service was 5 star.  My filet was not
data.text: The service was great.  We had a party of about 10 and were served efficiently and with friendliness.  I generally have the filet in steakhouses, and ordered the filet here.  It was cooked fine, but had a little more fat than a good filet should have.   The baked potato was very good.   The dessert selection was quite minimal.
